txt.en: The Quays of the Harlond
'Let the blood of our ancestors course through you, my men!'
'The snake gives us strength on this day!'
As you make towards the gate, the screeching of a fell-beast can be heard from above.
'That was for my sons!'
'That is the last of the Orcs along the wall. Seems the Enemy is afraid of us. Ha!'
'I lost count of how many Orcs we slew, but I think Halbarad and I tied.'
'Halbarad has agreed to have a rematch on the battlefield.'
'Legolas went off to fight some Mûmakil. I would be surprised if he didn't welcome your assistance.'
'Rangers! We must destroy this blockade!'
'You might find him towards the west, where Aragorn ran off to earlier.'
'I am just glad we made it!'
'Good luck!'
'Here they come!'
'The gate is open!'
'I accept your challenge. Let them come!'
'More Orcs ahead!'
'Looks like this welcoming post has turned into a blockade. Stop them from entering the city!'
'It is good to fight by your side.'
'Stand your ground. They'll go no further.'
'Stay alert, [placeholder].'
'If any of you lot try to run away, I'll have your heads!'
'Were you trying to flee the battle? It is not over, you fools!'
The Forsaken Reaver
'I came to greet the Corsairs of Umbar. Instead what do I find?!'
'Insolent stowaways. Wretched usurpers. How did this come to be?!'
'You refuse to answer for your crimes then. I will make sure you pay for riding the ships of Umbar.'
'Kálmok, make sure not one of these defiants leave the port. I am needed in battle.'
'Come brother, let us defend these good peoples.'
'The end has come for you. My brethren may have have fled the battle, but I remain.'
'I stand here with no orders, only to see you pay for what you have done to the Corsairs of Umbar.'
'In another life, I once called Umbar my home.'
'[placeholder], our paths cross again. I trust our entrance has remained unnoticed.'
'Those men, my lineage, failed me. That fault lies on you!'
'Tell me of the situation as we make our way through the Harlond.'
'Do not let them reach the land!'
'Halbarad, Elladan, Elrohir, we head for the southern gate of the Rammas. Quickly now!'
'Keep up the pace! We press onwards!'
'We must clear a path!'
'[placeholder], if all of the Harlond is blockaded like this, it will take far too long to join the battle.'
'I shall lead a charge to Pelennor, making way through the breach in the Rammas you told me about.'
'I hope that we are not too late to the battle.'
'Take you and your fellows through the Harlond and open that gate.'
'Help has arrived. Now is our chance to attack!'
'Great work!'
'It will be quickest for the rest of my men to enter the fields from that point, once the port is clear.'
'Thank you for your assistance. You are an even more adept warrior than last we met.'
'This way to battle!'
'Elladan has noticed an enemy fortification spanning the river to the east.'
'For Gondor!'
'Go and claim it while we flank the Haradrim forces to the north. Quickly now.'
'Where are the Corsairs?!'
'Let us move out! Keep your wits about you!'
'Good luck, [placeholder].'
'Exemplary work. I must go take charge of my men in a moment, for the success of this assault is critical.'
'[placeholder], help Gimli and Halbarad defeat Orcs along the Rammas.'
'Those fiends must not ambush the rest of my men as they make haste through the Harlond.'
'I am counting on you all.'
'Dwarves are not meant to sail on ships! Ugh.'
'Victory is at hand!'
'Well, looks like the Harlond has seen better days!'
'Hope does not deceive me.'
'Good to be back in the thick of battle!'
'We meet again, as I said we would, at the Hornburg. Not even the hosts of Mordor could deny this.'
'Then let us finish this day. We shall avenge our people, together.'
'A blockade? Looks like the Orcs are scared of us.'
'Aragorn!'
'Too many trolls in the woods for my liking.'
'As you spoke it then, you speak it now. Never was a meeting of friends indeed more joyful.'
'Ha!'
'Nor more timely. Much grief and loss has befallen us. You come none too soon.'
'Care for a friendly wager? Let's see who can slay the most Orcs over this way.'
'Now this is a battle!'
'Make them scatter like the snakes they are!'
'We shall see you again soon.'
